page.title: 07River Dun Navigation
page.content: The{River Dun Navigation}canal passes through Barnby Dun.It was built as a result of an Act of Parliament passed in 1809. One mile north of Barnby Dun it joins the New Junction Canal which links with the Aire and Calder and the ports of Goole and Liverpool. Part of the{South Yorkshire Navigation the canal's main cargo is coal and petroleum.AN interesting sight is the{ {Tom Puddings}_ a barge towing 17 large tubs containing coal approx.30 tons per tub. These barges are loaded at the Doncaster Wharf with coal from local pits and then travel to the port of Goole. In summer time this canal is used by increasing numbers of pleasure craft.
